Name: First Peoples Economic Growth Fund Inc.

Name: CanExport SMEs
Eligible_Activities: Gathering market intelligence (custom research, reports and studies), Applying for intellectual property protection in international markets, Applying for certification in international markets, Seeking expert legal and business advice, Search Engine Optimization, Translating, adapting or creating marketing materials, Attending virtual trade shows, networking functions, meetings or conferences, Visits to foreign markets, In-person participation at trade shows, networking functions, meetings or conferences, Participating in a trade mission
Eligible_Applicants: Eligible Canadian small and medium-sized enterprises must: be for-profit, be an incorporated legal entity, limited liability partnership (LLP) or cooperative, have an active Canada Revenue Agency business number, employ fewer than 500 full-time equivalent employees, have $100,000 to $100 million in declared revenue in Canada during its past fiscal year (or 12 months for quarterly filers)
Eligible_Criteria: Coming Soon
Description: CanExport SMEs is a funding program that supports non-travel and travel activities for eligible Canadian small and medium-sized enterprises to help them expand internationally. The program aims to provide financial assistance for activities such as market intelligence gathering, intellectual property protection, certification in international markets, expert legal and business advice, search engine optimization, and translation or adaptation of marketing materials. The program also supports virtual and in-person participation in trade shows, networking functions, meetings, conferences, and trade missions. Eligible applicants must be for-profit, incorporated legal entities, LLPs, or cooperatives with an active Canada Revenue Agency business number, fewer than 500 full-time equivalent employees, and $100,000 to $100 million in declared revenue in Canada.
Summary: CanExport SMEs provides funding to support Canadian small and medium-sized enterprises in their international expansion efforts through financial assistance for non-travel and travel activities. Eligible activities include market intelligence gathering, intellectual property protection, certification, expert advice, search engine optimization, and participation in trade-related events. To be eligible, applicants must meet certain criteria, including being for-profit, having an active Canada Revenue Agency business number, and meeting revenue and employee thresholds.
Grant_Goals: To provide financial support for Canadian small and medium-sized enterprises to expand into global markets through various non-travel and travel activities.

Name: Commercialization Consulting and Mentoring
Eligible_Activities: Hire consultants or mentors to help get a new and innovative product, technology, or process to market. Host group learning activities that will improve knowledge and preparedness for commercialization.
Eligible_Applicants: Small or medium sized business, University or Community College, Research institution (excluding Federal labs)
Eligible_Criteria: Applicants must demonstrate that the proposed activity supports the commercialization of a new and innovative product, technology, or process; and/or helps develop and maintain partnerships, technology transfers, and/or licensing agreements. Applicants must not make any financial commitments prior to submission, or costs incurred will not be eligible. Once the application is approved, costs incurred as of the date that the application was received by LearnSphere will be deemed admissible. Please note that meeting the eligibility criteria does not guarantee you will receive funding. Each eligible application will be subject to an evaluation process. A maximum of two projects is allowed per technology. Activities in a second project must demonstrate a progressive, incremental activity, and must not be a continuation of a previous project.
Description: The Commercialization Consulting and Mentoring Program (CCM) provides financial assistance to help Atlantic Canadian businesses and institutions in the final stages of commercialization. CCM is open to all industry sectors, except retail/wholesale, real estate, government services, personal or social services and softwood lumber.
Summary: The Commercialization Consulting and Mentoring Program (CCM) provides financial assistance to help Atlantic Canadian businesses and institutions in the final stages of commercialization.
Grant_Goals: To help Atlantic Canadian businesses and institutions in the final stages of commercialization.

Eligible_Criteria: Projects are analyzed against specific criteria including expected results, viability of the business or organization, technical and financial management capacity, contribution of partners, and degree of risk

Eligible_Applicants: FIRST NATIONS and corporations owned by a First Nation or the Native Alliance of Quebec or by one of their members
Eligible_Criteria: Be a First Nation or the Native Alliance of Quebec, have the necessary financial resources, present a viable business project, have a good credit rating, have experience and training in the field of activities, mandatory full-time involvement in the business, operate a business not involved in gambling, sex, alcohol, or tobacco
Description: The Aboriginal Business Financing Program (ABFP) provides a non-refundable contribution for start-up, expansion, and management of businesses for First Nations and related corporations.

Grant_Goals: To encourage employers to provide training or professional development, leading to new opportunities for Nunavummiut.

Name: Rapid Business Readiness Training
Eligible_Activities: Business management and marketing skills training
Eligible_Applicants: First Nations entrepreneurs
Eligible_Criteria: Applicants must submit an application that includes the purpose of the course as well as a course outline and a detailed budget. The applicant should have approached other First Nation educational funding agencies prior to applying to the Fund. Training must be through qualified trainers or organizations that have been approved by the Fund to provide appropriate training. Training must be specific to business management and not occupational training unrelated to the development of management and marketing skills. On-the-job training may qualify to better fit the needs of the entrepreneur or manager of a First Nation-owned business.
Description: The program supports rapid business readiness training for new and existing First Nations entrepreneurs to develop their management and marketing skills. Funding is available up to 75% of the approved costs, covering only direct course costs such as tuition, workshop fees, and books. Living expenses are not included, and the program is not intended to finance the acquisition of a degree or certificate.
Summary: The Rapid Business Readiness Training program supports First Nations entrepreneurs in developing their management and marketing skills through funding for specific training costs.
Grant_Goals: To develop management and marketing skills of First Nations entrepreneurs

Eligible_Applicants: Private sector employers, non-profit sector employers, First Nations and Metis Settlements, the Agriculture Financial Services Corporation, Alberta Treasury Branches
Eligible_Criteria: Applications must be submitted through the online portal. Training must meet certain requirements and be completed within specified timeframes. Payment processes and contact information are detailed in the provided documentation.
Description: The Canada-Alberta Job Grant provides funding for employers to help employees and unemployed Albertans access training opportunities. Employers must contribute a minimum of one-third of the total training costs for existing employees. The Government contributes two-thirds of the cost to a maximum of $10,000 per trainee per fiscal year. If hiring and training an unemployed Albertan, up to 100% of training costs could be covered, up to $15,000 per trainee.
Summary: The Canada-Alberta Job Grant offers financial support to help employers provide training for their employees and potential future employees. It aims to contribute to the development of a skilled workforce in Alberta.
Grant_Goals: To support employers in providing training for their employees and unemployed individuals to improve skills and contribute to Alberta's workforce development

Name: Starter Company Plus
Eligible_Activities: One-on-one guidance, business workshops, seminars, networking events, mentoring
Eligible_Applicants: 18 years of age or older, Ontario resident and Canadian citizen (or permanent resident), not attending school full-time or returning to school
Eligible_Criteria: Apply through a Small Business Enterprise Centre. Must be able to make a contribution of at least 25% of the grant amount.
Description: Starter Company Plus provides training, mentoring, and a grant of up to $5,000 for starting, expanding, or buying a small business in Ontario.
Summary: Starter Company Plus offers one-on-one guidance, workshops, mentoring, and a grant of up to $5,000 for Ontario residents starting or expanding a small business.
Grant_Goals: Supporting a strong, innovative economy that can provide jobs and prosperity for all Ontarians, with an additional mandate for small business.

Name: Aboriginal Business Financing Program (ABFP)
Eligible_Activities: Start-up, acquisition or expansion of a business, implementation of marketing activities, project-related management, professional advisory services after the business is launched, development of a business plan, marketing plan or feasibilities studies
Eligible_Applicants: FIRST NATIONS, Abenaki, Algonquin, Atikamekw, Cree, Huron-Wendat, Malecite, Micmac, NATIVE ALLIANCE OF QUEBEC
Eligible_Criteria: Be a First Nation or the Native Alliance of Quebec or a member of a First Nation or the Native Alliance of Quebec or a corporation owned by a First Nation, the Native Alliance of Quebec or by one of their members. Have the necessary financial resources, present a viable business project, have a good credit rating, have experience and training in the field of activities, mandatory full-time involvement in the business, not operate a business involved in gambling, sex, alcohol, tobacco
Description: The Aboriginal Business Financing Program (ABFP) provides non-refundable contributions for start-up, acquisition or expansion of a business, implementation of marketing activities, project-related management, professional advisory services after the business is launched, and development of a business plan, marketing plan or feasibilities studies for First Nations, Abenaki, Algonquin, Atikamekw, Cree, Huron-Wendat, Malecite, Micmac, and the NATIVE ALLIANCE OF QUEBEC.
Summary: The Aboriginal Business Financing Program (ABFP) offers non-refundable contributions of up to $99,999 for eligible First Nations and organizations in Quebec to support business development and growth projects.
Grant_Goals: To provide financial support for eligible First Nations and organizations in developing viable business projects and fostering economic growth within the community

Name: Grant for Nunavut Employers
Eligible_Activities: Training or professional development for Nunavummiut
Eligible_Applicants: Registered Nunavut-based employers
Eligible_Criteria: Contact CareerDevelopment-TLMP@gov.nu.ca for application forms or more information
Description: The Grant for Nunavut Employers encourages employers to provide training or professional development to Nunavummiut, leading to a new position, a promotion, increased pay within the organization, or regular employment. The Grant covers two-thirds of the eligible costs for each trainee, and funding is subject to availability in the form of a reimbursement to the employer based on the successful completion of training.
Summary: The Grant for Nunavut Employers encourages employers to provide training or professional development to Nunavummiut, leading to a new position, a promotion, increased pay within the organization, or regular employment.
Grant_Goals: Encourages employers to provide training or professional development to Nunavummiut

Name: Ignite
Eligible_Activities: Research and development of new, innovative technology in natural resources and applied sciences
Eligible_Applicants: Teams of academia and industry working on projects in natural resources and applied sciences
Eligible_Criteria: The project must support the research and development of a new, innovative technology that solves an industry problem in natural resources, engineering, or applied sciences. It must be a collaboration between a B.C. based industry and academic partner, with a majority of the project work occurring in B.C. The project partners must agree regarding IP ownership. The innovation must be at a minimum of Technology Readiness Level (TRL) of 3, with strong market potential and a strong research and commercialization plan aiming to achieve commercialization within 3 years of the project start date. The project must secure matching funds from industry or government sources at a 2:1 ratio.
Description: The grant aims to support the research and development of new, innovative technology that solves industry problems in natural resources, engineering, or applied sciences, with a focus on market potential and commercialization.
Summary: The Ignite grant provides up to $300,000 to support teams of academia and industry working on projects in natural resources and applied sciences, with a strong focus on market potential and commercialization.
Grant_Goals: To support the research and development of new, innovative technology that solves industry problems in natural resources, engineering, or applied sciences.

Name: CanExport Innovation
Eligible_Activities: Applying for intellectual property protection in international markets, Applying for certification in international markets, Seeking expert legal and business advice, Shipping technology to determine feasibility/compatibility with a partner's technology, Translating, adapting and creating promotional plans or materials, Attending virtual networking functions, meetings or conferences, Travel abroad or in Canada to meet with pre-identified foreign partners, Attending an event or conference to meet with pre-identified foreign partners
Eligible_Applicants: Canadian small and medium-sized enterprises, Canadian academic institutions, Canadian non-government research centres
Eligible_Criteria: Follow these steps to apply for CanExport Innovation: 1. Read the Applicant's Guide. 2. Have a Canada Revenue Agency (CRA) business number. 3. Own, co-own, or have decision-making authority over the intellectual property (IP) rights for the technology. 4. Have a prototype (Technology Readiness Level 4 or higher). 5. Intend to commercially launch the technology within 5 years.
Description: Innovators from Canadian organizations may access up to $75,000 in funding to assist with research and development (R&D) for a single technology. We cover up to 75% of costs to pursue and sign collaborative R&D agreements with international partners.
Summary: CanExport Innovation provides funding for research and development (R&D) activities to assist Canadian organizations in pursuing collaborative R&D agreements with international partners.
Grant_Goals: To support research and development (R&D) activities for Canadian organizations seeking to collaborate with international partners
